publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-364# Scott Barrie: Children's Panel Membershipâ€”That the Parliament recognises the huge contribution made to public life by volunteers; notes that the children's hearing system has now been in operation in Scotland for over 30 years; applauds the dedication and commitment of children's panel members in undertaking a difficult and demanding task; recognises the Scottish Executive's current recruitment campaign for additional panel members, and encourages people from all sections of the community, but in particular men, to consider applying for membership of the children's panel in their local area. Supported by: Margaret Jamieson*, Rhona Brankin*, Christine May*

S2M-364# Scott Barrie: Children's Panel Membership-That the Parliament recognises the huge contribution made to public life by volunteers; notes that the children's hearing system has now been in operation in Scotland for over 30 years; applauds the dedication and commitment of children's panel members in undertaking a difficult and demanding task; recognises the Scottish Executive's current recruitment campaign for additional panel members, and encourages people from all sections of the community, but in particular men, to consider applying for membership of the children's panel in their local area. Supported by: Margaret Jamieson, Rhona Brankin, Christine May, Tommy Sheridan*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-364# Children's Panel Membership (lodged on 18 September 2003) Fiona Hyslop*, Elaine Smith*, Cathie Craigie*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Christine Grahame*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*

S2M-364# Children's Panel Membership (lodged on 18 September 2003) Fergus Ewing*, Stewart Stevenson*, Ms Sandra White*, Helen Eadie*, Chris Ballance*, David Mundell*, Richard Lochhead*, Bill Butler*, Jackie Baillie*, Frances Curran*, Robin Harper*, Shiona Baird*, Robert Brown*, Karen Gillon*, Carolyn Leckie*, Colin Fox*, Trish Godman*, Maureen Macmillan*
S2M-364# Children's Panel Membership (lodged on 18 September 2003) Marlyn Glen*, Dr Jean Turner*, Pauline McNeill*, Donald Gorrie*, Michael McMahon*, Eleanor Scott*
S2M-364# Children's Panel Membership (lodged on 18 September 2003) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mike Pringle*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Janis Hughes*
S2M-364# Children's Panel Membership (lodged on 18 September 2003) Cathy Peattie*, Dennis Canavan*, Margo MacDonald*
S2M-364# Children's Panel Membership (lodged on 18 September 2003) Irene Oldfather*
S2M-364# Children's Panel Membership (lodged on 18 September 2003) Mr Stewart Maxwell*
S2M-364# Children's Panel Membership (lodged on 18 September 2003) Mary Scanlon*
S2M-364# Children's Panel Membership (lodged on 18 September 2003) Phil Gallie*

S2M-364# Scott Barrie: Children's Panel Membership-That the Parliament recognises the huge contribution made to public life by volunteers; notes that the children's hearing system has now been in operation in Scotland for over 30 years; applauds the dedication and commitment of children's panel members in undertaking a difficult and demanding task; recognises the Scottish Executive's current recruitment campaign for additional panel members, and encourages people from all sections of the community, but in particular men, to consider applying for membership of the children's panel in their local area. Supported by: Karen Whitefield*
S2M-364# Children's Panel Membership (lodged on 18 September 2003) Sarah Boyack*
S2M-364# Children's Panel Membership (lodged on 18 September 2003) Mr Duncan McNeil*
